 
namespace Gu.Units
{
    using System;
    using System.Globalization;
    using System.Xml;
    using System.Xml.Linq;
    using System.Xml.Schema;
    using System.Xml.Serialization;

	/// <summary>
    /// A type for the quantity Percent
    /// </summary>
    [Serializable]
	public partial struct Percent : IComparable<Percent>, IEquatable<Percent>, IFormattable, IXmlSerializable, IQuantity<PercentUnit, I1>
	{
	    /// <summary>
        /// The quantity in <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
		public readonly double Percent;
		
		private Percent(double percent)
        {
            Percent = percent;
        }

		/// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="value"></param>
        /// <param name="unit"><see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public Percent(double value, PercentUnit unit)
        {
            Percent = unit.ToSiUnit(value);
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// The quantity in Percent
        /// </summary>
        public double SiValue
        {
            get
            {
                return Percent;
            }
        }

 		
        /// <summary>
        /// The quantity in partsPerMillion
        /// </summary>
        public double PartsPerMillion
        {
            get
            {
                return PercentUnit.PartsPerMillion.FromSiUnit(Percent);
            }
        }
		
        /// <summary>
        /// The quantity in promille
        /// </summary>
        public double Promille
        {
            get
            {
                return PercentUnit.Promille.FromSiUnit(Percent);
            }
        }
		
        /// <summary>
        /// Creates an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> from its string representation
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="s">The string representation of the <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        /// <returns></returns>
        public static Percent Parse(string s)
        {
            return Parser.Parse<PercentUnit, Percent>(s, From);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Reads an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> from the <paramref name="reader"/>
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="reader"></param>
        /// <returns>An instance of  <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></returns>
        public static Percent ReadFrom(XmlReader reader)
        {
            var v = new Percent();
            v.ReadXml(reader);
            return v;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Creates a new instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="quantity"></param>
        /// <param name="unit"></param>
        public static Percent From(double value, PercentUnit unit)
        {
            return new Percent(unit.ToSiUnit(value));
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// Creates a new instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="quantity"></param>
        public static Percent FromPercent(double value)
        {
            return new Percent(value);
        }

 		
        /// <summary>
        /// Creates a new instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="quantity"></param>
        public static Percent FromPartsPerMillion(double value)
        {
            return From(value, PercentUnit.PartsPerMillion);
        }
		
        /// <summary>
        /// Creates a new instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="quantity"></param>
        public static Percent FromPromille(double value)
        {
            return From(value, PercentUnit.Promille);
        }
				 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether two <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> instances are equal.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantitys of <paramref name="left"/> and <paramref name="right"/> are equal; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator ==(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return left.Equals(right);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether two <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> instances are not equal.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantitys of <paramref name="left"/> and <paramref name="right"/> are not equal; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator !=(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return !left.Equals(right);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> is less than another specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantity of <paramref name="left"/> is less than the quantity of <paramref name="right"/>; otherwise, false. 
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator <(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return left.Percent < right.Percent;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> is greater than another specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantity of <paramref name="left"/> is greater than the quantity of <paramref name="right"/>; otherwise, false. 
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator >(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return left.Percent > right.Percent;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> is less than or equal to another specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantity of <paramref name="left"/> is less than or equal to the quantity of <paramref name="right"/>; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator <=(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return left.Percent <= right.Percent;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Indicates whether a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> is greater than or equal to another specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if the quantity of <paramref name="left"/> is greater than or equal to the quantity of <paramref name="right"/>; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        public static bool operator >=(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return left.Percent >= right.Percent;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Multiplies an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="left"/> and returns the result.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="right">An instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        /// <param name="left">An instance of <seealso cref="T:System.Double"/></param>
        /// <returns>Multiplies an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="left"/> and returns the result.</returns>
        public static Percent operator *(double left, Percent right)
        {
            return new Percent(left*right.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Multiplies an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="right"/> and returns the result.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="left">An instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        /// <param name="right">An instance of <seealso cref="T:System.Double"/></param>
        /// <returns>Multiplies an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="right"/> and returns the result.</returns>
        public static Percent operator *(Percent left, double right)
        {
            return new Percent(left.Percent*right);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Divides an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="right"/> and returns the result.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="left">An instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        /// <param name="right">An instance of <seealso cref="T:System.Double"/></param>
        /// <returns>Divides an instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with <paramref name="right"/> and returns the result.</returns>
        public static Percent operator /(Percent left, double right)
        {
            return new Percent(left.Percent / right);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Adds two specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> instances.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> whose quantity is the sum of the quantitys of <paramref name="left"/> and <paramref name="right"/>.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.</param>
        /// <param name="right">A TimeSpan.</param>
        public static Percent operator +(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return new Percent(left.Percent + right.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Subtracts an Percent from another Percent and returns the difference.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> that is the difference
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="left">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> (the minuend).</param>
        /// <param name="right">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> (the subtrahend).</param>
        public static Percent operator -(Percent left, Percent right)
        {
            return new Percent(left.Percent - right.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Returns an <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> whose quantity is the negated quantity of the specified instance.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> with the same numeric quantity as this instance, but the opposite sign.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="Percent">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        public static Percent operator -(Percent Percent)
        {
            return new Percent(-1*Percent.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Returns the specified instance of <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// Returns <paramref name="Percent"/>.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="Percent">A <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/></param>
        public static Percent operator +(Percent Percent)
        {
            return Percent;
        }
 
        public override string ToString()
        {
            return this.ToString((string)null, (IFormatProvider)NumberFormatInfo.CurrentInfo);
        }
 
        public string ToString(string format)
        {
            return this.ToString(format, (IFormatProvider)NumberFormatInfo.CurrentInfo);
        }
 
        public string ToString(IFormatProvider provider)
        {
            return this.ToString((string)null, (IFormatProvider)NumberFormatInfo.GetInstance(provider));
        }
 
        public string ToString(string format, IFormatProvider formatProvider)
        {
            return this.ToString(format, formatProvider, PercentUnit.Percent);
        }
 
        public string ToString(string format, IFormatProvider formatProvider, PercentUnit unit)
        {
            var quantity = unit.FromSiUnit(this.Percent);
            return string.Format("{0}{1}", quantity.ToString(format, formatProvider), unit.Symbol);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Compares this instance to a specified <see cref="T:MathNet.Spatial.Units.Percent"/> object and returns an integer that indicates whether this <see cref="instance"/> is shorter than, equal to, or longer than the <see cref="T:MathNet.Spatial.Units.Percent"/> object.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// A signed number indicating the relative quantitys of this instance and <paramref name="quantity"/>.
        /// 
        ///                     Value
        /// 
        ///                     Description
        /// 
        ///                     A negative integer
        /// 
        ///                     This instance is smaller than <paramref name="quantity"/>.
        /// 
        ///                     Zero
        /// 
        ///                     This instance is equal to <paramref name="quantity"/>.
        /// 
        ///                     A positive integer
        /// 
        ///                     This instance is larger than <paramref name="quantity"/>.
        /// 
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="quantity">A <see cref="T:MathNet.Spatial.Units.Percent"/> object to compare to this instance.</param>
        public int CompareTo(Percent quantity)
        {
            return this.Percent.CompareTo(quantity.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Returns a quantity indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> object.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if <paramref name="other"/> represents the same Percent as this instance; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="other">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> object to compare with this instance.</param>
        public bool Equals(Percent other)
        {
            return this.Percent.Equals(other.Percent);
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Returns a quantity indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> object within the given tolerance.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// true if <paramref name="other"/> represents the same Percent as this instance; otherwise, false.
        /// </returns>
        /// <param name="other">An <see cref="T:Gu.Units.Percent"/> object to compare with this instance.</param>
        /// <param name="tolerance">The maximum difference for being considered equal</param>
        public bool Equals(Percent other, double tolerance)
        {
            return Math.Abs(this.Percent - other.Percent) < tolerance;
        }
 
        public override bool Equals(object obj)
        {
            if (ReferenceEquals(null, obj))
            {
                return false;
            }
 
            return obj is Percent && this.Equals((Percent)obj);
        }
 
        public override int GetHashCode()
        {
            return this.Percent.GetHashCode();
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// This method is reserved and should not be used. When implementing the IXmlSerializable interface, 
        /// you should return null (Nothing in Visual Basic) from this method, and instead, 
        /// if specifying a custom schema is required, apply the <see cref="T:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProviderAttribute"/> to the class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns>
        /// An <see cref="T:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"/> that describes the XML representation of the object that is produced by the
        ///  <see cref="M:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)"/> 
        /// method and consumed by the <see cref="M:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)"/> method.
        /// </returns>
        public XmlSchema GetSchema()
        {
            return null;
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Generates an object from its XML representation.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="reader">The <see cref="T:System.Xml.XmlReader"/> stream from which the object is deserialized. </param>
        public void ReadXml(XmlReader reader)
        {
            reader.MoveToContent();
            var e = (XElement)XNode.ReadFrom(reader);
 
            // Hacking set readonly fields here, can't think of a cleaner workaround
            XmlExt.SetReadonlyField(ref this, x => x.Percent, XmlConvert.ToDouble(XmlExt.ReadAttributeOrElementOrDefault(e, "Value")));
        }
 
        /// <summary>
        /// Converts an object into its XML representation.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="writer">The <see cref="T:System.Xml.XmlWriter"/> stream to which the object is serialized. </param>
        public void WriteXml(XmlWriter writer)
        {
            XmlExt.WriteAttribute(writer, "Value", this.Percent);
        }
	}
}
